info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 16 at 7:14AM PST until November 16 at 1:15PM PST by NWS Los Angeles/Oxnard CA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following county, Santa Barbara.
* WHEN...Until 115 PM PST Sunday.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 711 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain falling across southern Santa Barbara County. Short-duration intense bursts of rainfall will occur across the advisory over the next several hours. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Flooding of low- lying areas is likely. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Santa Barbara, Montecito, Carpinteria, Isla Vista, Summerland, El Capitan and Refugio State Beaches, Gaviota State Park, Goleta, and Mission Canyon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON
